guide.introduction: It is important that you have a working knowledge of the Arduino, networking and basic programming.
guide.introduction_rendered:
It is important that you have a working knowledge of the Arduino, networking and basic programming.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino Uno
  • Arduino Netshield
  • MakerShield
  • Header pins, male, snap-off
  • Header pins, female, snap-off
  • adafruit max6675 temp sensor
  • humidity sensor
  • Jumper Wire
Tools
  • Soldering Iron, Wire strippers

lines.text: These custom headers will be used as spacers between the Netshield and the MakerShield.

lines.text: NOTE: The center pin on the longer spacer will not be used. I left it to make the unit stronger.

guide.summary: This guide will show you how to build the circuit and write the program to build your own Arduino Temp / Humidity monitor that can be viewed via LCD display, webpage and SNMP.
guide.title: Arduino Temp / Humidity Monitor with Web and SNMP
